title: Xal0lex
author: Xal0lex
content: Sooner or later the bearish trend will end. What trends will be in the new bull run? In one of the many articles on the topic of future trends I saw this interesting list.QuoteInstitutional blockchainsSocial tokensReal YieldGamingLayer 2sLayer 0Options protocolsAs you can see, this list does not include trends from the past bullrun (except gaming), such as nft and metaverse. Are we in for a whole new hype or will the old trends also give themselves away?Your thoughts.

comments.author: blockman
comments.body: I think we're done with the gaming. Also, I think with social tokens, I've seen some attempts of it but it didn't really click at all. Maybe as big as Google and Amazon can do this.We've seen Facebook try it but they have failed it as they went to focus on Metaverse which is also a failure because the market is no longer in that hype. I think it's going to be the first choice since there's now the echoing of CBDCs then which might be the start of institutional blockchains and projects that's connected to it.

comments.body: No clues I guess except for what we all know that halving would take place in 2024. Earlier dates on that would be absurd. There could be a trend which may unxepectedly enter the industry likewise with how memecoins, nft, and p2e, emerged out of nowhere even if there are existing for years already. So maybe, trend will also come from existing concepts in this industry. comments.body: As I say, there should be Layer3 also, I have seen its communities and its partners, regarding their bounties on the layer3 site, that was simply amazing.
